intro: Hypoestes lasioclada, commonly known as the "Snowflake" plant, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its striking, bi-color leaves that often feature white and green patterns. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture with a waxy appearance. Hypoestes lasioclada is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
